      • getReadableClassNames

        public static ObjectList getReadableClassNames(Object[] o)
        Given the specified list of objects, return readable names for the class types of the objects.
        Parameters:
        o - The objects.
        Returns:
        An array of readable class type strings.

      • getReadableClassName

        public static String getReadableClassName(Class<?> c)
        Shortcut for calling getReadableClassName(c.getName())
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getReadableClassNameForObject

        public static String getReadableClassNameForObject(Object o)
        Shortcut for calling getReadableClassName(c.getClass().getName())
        Parameters:
        o - The object whose class we want to render.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getReadableClassName

        public static String getReadableClassName(String className)
        Converts the specified class name to a readable form when class name is a special construct like "[[Z".
        Example:

        getReadableClassName("java.lang.Object"); // Returns "java.lang.Object" getReadableClassName("boolean"); // Returns "boolean" getReadableClassName("[Z"); // Returns "boolean[]" getReadableClassName("[[Z"); // Returns "boolean[][]" getReadableClassName("[Ljava.lang.Object;"); // Returns "java.lang.Object[]" getReadableClassName(null); // Returns null

        Parameters:
        className - The class name.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getClassFromReadableName

        public static Class<?> getClassFromReadableName(ClassLoader cl,
                                                String name)
                                         throws ClassNotFoundException
        Converts the string generated by getReadableClassName(Class) back into a Class.

        Generics are stripped from the string since they cannot be converted to a class.

        Parameters:
        cl - The classloader to use to load the class.
        name - The readable class name.
        Returns:
        The class object.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException

      • isParentClass

        public static boolean isParentClass(Class<?> parent,
                                    Class<?> child,
                                    boolean strict)
        Returns true if parent is a parent class of child.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent class.
        child - The child class.
        strict - If true returns false if the classes are the same.
        Returns:
        true if parent is a parent class of child.

      • isParentClass

        public static boolean isParentClass(Class<?> parent,
                                    Class<?> child)
        Returns true if parent is a parent class or the same as child.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent class.
        child - The child class.
        Returns:
        true if parent is a parent class or the same as child.

      • getMethodSignature

        public static String getMethodSignature(Method m)
        Returns the signature of the specified method. For no-arg methods, the signature will be a simple string such as "toString". For methods with one or more args, the arguments will be fully-qualified class names (e.g. "append(java.util.StringBuilder,boolean)")
        Parameters:
        m - The methods to get the signature on.
        Returns:
        The methods signature.

      • getPrimitiveWrapper

        public static Class<?> getPrimitiveWrapper(Class<?> c)
        If the specified class is a primitive (e.g. int.class) returns it's wrapper class (e.g. Integer.class).
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        The wrapper class, or null if class is not a primitive.

      • getPrimitiveForWrapper

        public static Class<?> getPrimitiveForWrapper(Class<?> c)
        If the specified class is a primitive wrapper (e.g. Integer.class) returns it's primitive class (e.g. int.class).
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        The primitive class, or null if class is not a primitive wrapper.

      • getWrapperIfPrimitive

        public static Class<?> getWrapperIfPrimitive(Class<?> c)
        If the specified class is a primitive (e.g. int.class) returns it's wrapper class (e.g. Integer.class).
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        The wrapper class if it's primitive, or the same class if class is not a primitive.

      • findNoArgConstructor

        public static final <T> Constructor<T> findNoArgConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                            Visibility v)
        Locates the no-arg constructor for the specified class. Constructor must match the visibility requirements specified by parameter 'v'. If class is abstract, always returns null. Note that this also returns the 1-arg constructor for non-static member classes.
        Parameters:
        c - The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
        v - The minimum visibility.
        Returns:
        The constructor, or null if no no-arg constructor exists with the required visibility.

      • resolveParameterType

        public static Class<?> resolveParameterType(Class<?> c,
                                            int index,
                                            Class<?> oc)
        Finds the real parameter type of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        c - The class containing the parameters (e.g. PojoSwap<T,S>)
        index - The zero-based index of the parameter to resolve.
        oc - The class we're trying to resolve the parameter type for.
        Returns:
        The resolved real class.
